text: $MU DRAM & HBM make sure the kitchen doesn’t stall or forget orders even when everything is already in place.

Warren Buffett & Charlie Munger openly admitted passing on $GOOGL was a massive mistake.

They watched GEICO pay ~$10 per click into a near-zero marginal cost business & still didn’t act.

A mistake Buffett made sure didn’t last with Berkshire initiating a ~$4B position just two months before he retired.

$AMZN operating margin has ~5x over the past 3 years as logistics automation scaled across the business.

More than 1M robots now operate across its fulfillment network & with last-mile delivery making up ~50% of shipping costs, each additional layer of automation directly expands margins.

Robotics is becoming the physical expression of the AI economy & this leverage is only beginning to show up in the numbers.

THE 8 LAYERS OF THE REAL-WORLD AI BOOM

1. $NVDA, $AMD, $ASML, $ARM & $AVGO design & manufacture the processors that AI models run on.

2. Those chips only work at scale because of networking & optics where $ANET, $CRDO, $CIEN, $LITE & $AAOI move massive amounts of data between servers, racks & entire data centers so AI systems can operate as one.

3. $VRT & $DELL then provide the physical systems like the servers, cooling & power management that keep AI systems running nonstop under extreme loads.

4. Memory & storage make AI intelligence usable where $MU, $SNDK, $WDC, $STX & $PSTG store the data that models are trained on & pull from when they generate answers.

5. Behind the scenes are the compute operators like $IREN, $CIFR & $WULF which supply large-scale, power-secured infrastructure capable of running AI workloads continuously.

6. Because AI power demand isn’t smooth that means battery & energy storage become critical where $EOSE & $FLNC stabilize load by storing energy & releasing it when data-center demand spikes.

7. None of this works without electricity which $VST, $CEG, $TLN, $OKLO, $BE & $GEV generate & manage to keep AI running 24/7.

8. On top of all of this sit the cloud platforms like $MSFT, $GOOGL, $AMZN & $ORCL along with neoclouds like $NBIS, $GLXY, $CRWV & $APLD which turn raw infrastructure into AI capacity that companies rent by the hour.

Modern chips only keep getting faster because we can pack billions of tiny switches onto silicon at scales so small that only one machine in the world can make them.

$ASML EUV tools are that machine.

$RKLB & $ASTS now make up 23% of my growth portfolio.

That should tell you how I’m thinking about space in 2026.
$IREN & $CIFR keep the lights on for the overnight shift

Fibonacci levels help you see where momentum pauses by mapping potential areas of support & resistance using ratios from the Fib sequence.

I find them useful because strong trends often consolidate at these levels before continuing higher.

Venezuela holds ~20% of the world’s proven oil reserves yet accounts for just ~1% of global production.

The significance of today is that the largest untapped oil reserve on earth is effectively being reopened.

Lower oil prices translate directly into cheaper gasoline which eases pressure at the pump which matters a ton heading into the midterms.

AI JUST OPENED THE RESTAURANT

$NVDA designed the kitchen

$ASML built the machines that made the appliances possible

$TSM built the appliances

$AMD adds extra burners so the kitchen can handle peak hours

$AVGO runs the order tickets so dishes move from station to station without chaos

$CRWD guards the doors

$SNOW preps & serves the ingredients

$PLTR is the chef turning those ingredients into real decisions that drive the business

I have been helping families in Venezuela for 10 years and anyone who hasn’t been there or in close contact with people there have no clue. People are just addicted to being mad. Well while ur mad, Venezuela is happy for the first time in 25 years.

China has been the largest buyer of Venezuelan oil throughout 2025, importing an average of approximately 550,000 to 600,000 barrels per day (bpd) despite ongoing sanctions on Venezuela's oil sector (imposed since 2019 and escalated in late 2025).
For the uninformed that think Russia and China had no interest in Venezuelan oil, gold or minerals, perhaps they'd like to buy some magic beans I just came across...

Microsoft’s $MSFT Fairwater Wisconsin data center is expected to be one of the largest and most expensive facilities to come online over the next few years, with potential capacity of 3.3GW costing $106 billion, per EpochAI. 

$NVDA $AMD $GOOG $META $ORCL

AI could potentially account for 20% of global DRAM capacity in 2026, fueled by rising HBM and GDDR7 demand, which both consume ~4X and ~1.7X capacity per GB versus standard DRAM, per the Commercial Times. 

$MU $AMD $NVDA

Memory is expected to be the fastest growing market in the semiconductor industry in 2026, with sales currently projected to rise 39.4% YoY to nearly $295 billion, accelerating from 27.8% growth in 2025.

$MU $NVDA $AMD $AVGO

It’s good to know the sectors.  Then chart them each day and a create a “Go To List”
Then u create an order of best set ups and relative Strength each day.  That’s usually how I do my Note each day.
I think u can learn a lot from these 4 minutes. It’s good to have multiple ways to approach the market each and Every Year!
The bullish candlestick pattern shows buying interest entering the market, while RSI confirms that it is recovering from oversold conditions, signalling a potential reversal.

The Relative Strength Index (RSI) is a popular momentum oscillator used in technical analysis to measure the speed and magnitude of recent price changes of a security. It helps identify overbought or oversold conditions, potential trend reversals, and price correction opportunities.
